author: The Record
title: NBA notes: Tristan Thompson, Cavaliers agree on contract - Basketball
text:
Thompson, Cavs agree 
Already an elite rebounder, Tristan Thompson snatched a long-term contract from the Cavaliers.
The restricted free-agent forward has agreed in principle with the defending Eastern Conference champions on a five-year, $82 million contract, ending his holdout and giving the Cavs needed frontcourt depth as they enter a new season.
The team confirmed Wednesday night that it had a verbal agreement with Thompson, who helped the Cavs get to the NBA Finals last season by filling in for an injured Kevin Love. Thompson had been seeking a maximum deal, while the Cavs made it known they valued the former No. 4 overall pick but weren’t going to overpay for a reserve.
Briefs 
The Milwaukee branch of the NAACP says Bucks forward John Henson deserves more than a "closed-door apology" from the owner of a Wisconsin jewelry store where Henson said employees racially profiled him. Henson said employees on Monday refused to let him in the store, then called police.
The Spurs have waived guard Jimmer Fredette. The former BYU star, the 10th pick of the 2011 NBA Draft, now is looking for his fifth team in five years. … Pelicans guard Tyreke Evans has had arthroscopic surgery on his right knee; there was no immediate timetable for his return. … The Bucks cut former Knick forward Marcus Landry.
— The Associated Press
